Sodium is a modern, easy-to-use software library for encryption,
decryption, signatures, password hashing and more.

pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and

dependencies.name: libbsd
dependencies.description:
This library provides useful functions commonly found on BSD systems,
and lacking on others like GNU systems, thus making it easier to port
projects with strong BSD origins, without needing to embed the same code
over and over again on each project.

dependent_to.name: xeus
dependent_to.description: QuantStack C++ implementation of Jupyter kernel protocol

dependent_to.name: mariadb
dependent_to.description:
MariaDB Server is one of the most popular database servers in the world.
MariaDB turns data into structured information in a wide array of
applications, ranging from banking to websites. It is an enhanced, drop-
in replacement for MySQL. MariaDB is used because it is fast, scalable
and robust, with a rich ecosystem of storage engines, plugins and many
other tools make it very versatile for a wide variety of use cases.

dependent_to.name: r-rzmq
dependent_to.description:
R Bindings for 'ZeroMQ' Interface to the 'ZeroMQ' lightweight messaging
kernel (see <http://www.zeromq.org/> for more information).

dependent_to.name: helics
dependent_to.description:
HELICS is a general-purpose, modular, highly-scalable co-simulation
framework that runs cross-platform (Linux, Windows, and Mac OS X) and
supports both event driven and time series simulation.

dependent_to.name: f77-zmq
dependent_to.description: Fortran binding for the ZeroMQ communication library

dependent_to.name: ps-lite
dependent_to.description:
ps-lite is A light and efficient implementation of the parameter server
framework.

dependent_to.name: r-pbdzmq
dependent_to.description:
Programming with Big Data -- Interface to 'ZeroMQ' 'ZeroMQ' is a well-
known library for high-performance asynchronous messaging in scalable,
distributed applications. This package provides high level R wrapper
functions to easily utilize 'ZeroMQ'. We mainly focus on interactive
client/server programming frameworks. For convenience, a minimal
'ZeroMQ' library (4.1.0 rc1) is shipped with 'pbdZMQ', which can be used
if no system installation of 'ZeroMQ' is available. A few wrapper
functions compatible with 'rzmq' are also provided.

dependent_to.name: adios2
dependent_to.description:
The Adaptable Input Output System version 2, developed in the Exascale
Computing Program

dependent_to.name: libnrm
dependent_to.description:
Libnrm, the application instrumentation library for the Node Resource
Manager(NRM).

dependent_to.name: czmq
dependent_to.description: A C interface to the ZMQ library

dependent_to.name: ffmpeg
dependent_to.description:
FFmpeg is a complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and
stream audio and video.
